page.title: 16Early Christianity in Irvine
page.content: The first news of{Christianity}was brought to Irvine by a monk called{St. {Inan.}For his first church, he chose a site on a hill overlooking the River Irvine. The hill was close to a ford in the river known as the{Puddle Ford} or{Puddley Doodley}as it's known locally. Towns people from across the river could use the ford to make their way to St. Inan's church. The present{ {Irvine Old Parish Church}is built on the same place and our school is built on the church ground -{The Glebe.}Near the school, down a lane beside the river, is{St. Inan's well}where the monk got his water. St. Inan is the Patron Saint of Irvine.
